author: Kate King
title: Settlement Eases the Way for Mosque in Bayonne
text:
A New Jersey city has agreed to pay $400,000 to resolve a lawsuit that alleged religious discrimination against a Muslim group that was seeking to open the city’s first mosque, according to a settlement agreement filed in federal court on Wednesday.
The settlement requires zoning officials in Bayonne, N.J., to allow the group, Bayonne Muslims, to move forward with its plans to renovate a vacant warehouse for use as a mosque.
